availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Albert A. Nance (Hopkins County, Ky, farmer & corporal 35th KY Inf USA )

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. North Carolina native. Married to Bertha Fowler Nance in Granville County, North Carolina, on August 28, 1841. Father of Abner W. Nance, Richard J. Nance, Isacah S. Nance, Elijah O. Nance, Elisha R. Nance, Minnie B. Nance, and Comodore Nance. Farmer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1860. Resident of Hopkins County in 1863. Served in the 35th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U. S. A.) as a corporal from October 1, 1863, to December 29, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 818.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Precinct 3, p. 54A.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Hopkins County Administrators Bonds, 1877-1889, p. 33.
North Carolina Marriage Bonds - Abstracts, 1760-1957, North Carolina State Archives, Raleigh, NC, RG 048, Granville County, p. 35.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 353.
